holidays.name: World Humanitarian Day
holidays.description: A day to honor humanitarian workers and raise awareness about humanitarian assistance worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2008 to commemorate the 2003 bombing in Baghdad that killed 22 humanitarian aid workers.
holidays.funFact: The red ribbon symbol used for aid workers on this day represents their commitment to saving lives in conflict zones.

holidays.name: National Potato Day (USA)
holidays.description: A celebration of the humble potato in all its forms ‚Äì mashed, baked, fried, or roasted!
holidays.origin: Became popular as a quirky food day in the U.S., celebrated primarily online by potato enthusiasts.
holidays.funFact: Potatoes were the first vegetable to be grown in space, aboard the Space Shuttle Columbia in 1995!

holidays.name: All Or Nothing Day
holidays.description: A quirky day encouraging people to take bold risks and go "all or nothing" in some aspect of their life.
holidays.origin: Origin uncertain, but gained attention through motivational communities online urging bold choices.
holidays.funFact: Some people use this day to finally commit to that wild dream or crazy idea they've been hesitating on.

holidays.name: Photography Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate the art and science of capturing moments through photography.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the invention of the Daguerreotype process announced on August 19, 1839, the first publicly available photographic process.
holidays.funFact: August 19th marks the birthday of some famous photographers who changed visual storytelling forever.
